xyz.acygn.mokapot

Class IndirectStandin<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.acygn.mokapot.IndirectStandin<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The class this standin is standing in for, i.e. the actual class of the standin's referent.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    LongReference, ProxyOrWrapper<T>, Standin<T>

    public abstract class IndirectStandin<T>
extends Object
implements Standin<T>
    Abstract implementation of composition-based standins. In other words, a standin object that's separate from the object holding its data. These objects cannot be used to proxy method calls (as they have the wrong type), but can be used as wrappers to allow methods of Standin to be called on arbitrary objects.

    As long as the standin remains in stored-in-self status, the standin can be converted to a reference simply by taking its referent (it's a short reference, not a long reference, but it's still a valid reference). This means that composition-based standins, whilst less general than inheritance-based standins, can nonetheless be used as the standin via which a location manager records the location of a local object. The only operation a location manager might want to do, but cannot do with a composition-based standin, is to convert the standin away from stored-in-self status (i.e. migrate the object).

    "Generalising" a composition-based standin to a form of standin that allows all operations can be done indirectly via describing the standin, and taking the location manager offline (allowing a new inheritance-based standin to be created), but only if the referent is locally dead. This is not a condition that's currently detected by the standin code (note that it's easy to detect whether the standin is locally dead, but that's the opposite of what you'd want). Thus, at present, an object that's managed via a composition-based standin cannot be migrated.

    In most cases, a composition-based standin will be of a specialised class that was generated (ahead of time or just in time) to have the fastest possible implementation for a given actual class of referent. In cases where (for whatever reason) code can't be generated, it's possible to use ReflectiveStandin, but note that this will likely be considerably slower.

    Author:
    Alex Smith

    • Constructor Detail

      • IndirectStandin

        protected IndirectStandin(T referent)
        Initializes this standin's referent. Note that this object might not be continuously referenced by the standin; the standin will drop its reference to the referent if taken out of stored-in-self status.
        Parameters:
        referent - The referent which this standin forwards methods to when in stored-in-self status.

      • IndirectStandin

        protected IndirectStandin(Class<T> referentClass,
                          ObjectDescription description,
                          Authorisation auth)
                   throws IOException
        Creates a new standin, likewise with a new referent, via reproducing a description. This can, if necessary, be used simply as a method of converting a description into a referent (via creating the standin, then taking the referent and dropping the standin).
        Parameters:
        referentClass - T.class, given explicitly due to Java's type erasure rules.
        description - The description that's reproduced to create the referent.
        auth - The authorisation that the caller has to call this constructor; cannot be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - If something goes wrong reading from the description

    • Method Detail

      • getStorage

        public StandinStorage<T> getStorage(Authorisation auth)
        Description copied from interface: Standin
        Gets the mechanism that this standin uses to store its data. This should be stored on a private mutable field of the standin, and can typically simply be a direct getter method (that checks the provided authorisation and then returns the field).

        The default value of the standin storage field should be a new object of class TrivialStandinStorage.

        Specified by:
        getStorage in interface Standin<T>
        Parameters:
        auth - An authorisation, for namespacing purposes; need not be verified (no information in a StandinStorage object is secret, although much of it is not really intelligible outside this package) and thus can be null.
        Returns:
        This standin's storage mechanism.

      • setStorage

        public void setStorage(StandinStorage<T> storage,
                       Authorisation auth)
        Description copied from interface: Standin
        Sets the mechanism that this standin uses to store its data. This should be stored on a private mutable field of the standin, and can typically simply be a direct setter method (that checks the provided authorisation and then returns the field). As an exception, standins for Copiable objects will never have their standin storage set (because copiable objects can't be long references, can't be long-referenced, and can't be migrated), so this method will not be called in this case and may error out if called.

        Note that although this method should not have side effects, the field storage must. Most notably, each method of the standin whose purpose is to access the standin's data (i.e. the methods of the superclass and the various implemented interfaces) should first check to see if the field in question contains an object that implements ForwardingStandinStorage. If it does, the method should forward its parameters rather than just calling the method on the referent (as would be used when in stored-in-self status).

        The standin storage object can also have other side effects (e.g. it can have a nontrivial finaliser). This is handled automatically, though, and need not be handled by the standin itself.

        Specified by:
        setStorage in interface Standin<T>
        Parameters:
        storage - The new storage mechanism.
        auth - An authorisation, for namespacing and verification purposes; cannot be null (and must be verified by the implementation of this method using Authorisation#verify).

      • getReferent

        public T getReferent(Authorisation auth)
        Description copied from interface: Standin
        Gets the underlying object behind this standin. For a composition-based standin, this is a different object. For an inheritance-based object, this is the standin itself; as such, it must return this. This method can safely be used to determine whether a standin is inheritance-based, via checking to see if the return value is equal to the standin itself using reference equality.

        Bear in mind that this is a very low-level operation; the object in question might not be currently in use to store the standin's data, for example. As such, it's probably useful only in cases where the referent is already known to be local (e.g. when creating a location manager for it).

        Specified by:
        getReferent in interface Standin<T>
        Parameters:
        auth - An authorisation, for namespacing and verification purposes; cannot be null (and must be verified by the implementation of this method using Authorisation#verify).
        Returns:
        The local referent of this standin.

      • initialiseFields

        protected abstract void initialiseFields(ReadableDescription description,
                                         Authorisation auth)
                                  throws IOException
        Initialises the fields of the referent from the given description. This method is used by the implementation of replaceWithReproduction in order to implement the description-reading part of the method (that method also handles some internal bookkeeping needed to keep its internal state consistent, and thus cannot be overridden directly).

        When this method is called, referent's fields should be treated as uninitialised, unknown data, and should be overwritten without reading them. (In particular, it's possible that referent will be in an inconsistent state that violates its invariants, e.g. it's possible that a field that should never be null will be null.)

        Parameters:
        description - The description from which to initialise the
        auth - An authorisation which can be used to, e.g., assign values to final or private fields of the referent
        Throws:
        IOException - If the description appears to be corrupted

      • replaceWithReproduction

        public final void replaceWithReproduction(ReadableDescription description,
                                          Authorisation auth)
                                   throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Standin
        Replaces the content of this standin's referent with a reproduction of the given description. In other words, we're effectively "overwriting" the content of this standin. This method is typically called just before the standin becomes the canonical place to store data for the object it's standing in for (either because it's about to enter stored-in-self status, or else because its local location manager wants to use it to store data).

        If the referent has been dropped, this method instead creates a new referent from the given description.

        Specified by:
        replaceWithReproduction in interface Standin<T>
        Parameters:
        description - The description to reproduce.
        auth - An authorisation, for namespacing and verification purposes; cannot be null (and must be verified by the implementation of this method using Authorisation#verify).
        Throws:
        IOException - If the description appears to be corrupted

      • dropResources

        public void dropResources(Authorisation auth)
        Drops the referent, causing this standin to no longer hold its own data. Naturally, this should only be called if the standin's own data is no longer in use; you'll need to change the storage method first. The storage method can't be changed back until the standin has been given a new referent using replaceWithReproduction.
        Specified by:
        dropResources in interface Standin<T>
        Parameters:
        auth - The authorisation that the caller has to call this method; cannot be null
